definition: used before countable or singular nouns referring to people or things that have not already been mentioned
example: a man/horse/unit

definition: to leave somebody, especially somebody you are responsible for, with no intention of returning
example: abandon somebody, The baby had been abandoned by its mother.

definition: the fact that somebody/something is able to do something
example: People with the disease may lose their ability to communicate.

definition: to have the skill, intelligence, opportunity, etc. needed to do something
example: You must be able to speak French for this job.

definition: to officially end a law, a system or an institution
example: This tax should be abolished.

definition: the deliberate ending of a pregnancy at an early stage
example: to support/oppose abortion

definition: a little more or less than; a little before or after
example: It costs about $10.

definition: on the subject of somebody/something; in connection with somebody/something

definition: at or to a higher place

definition: at or to a higher place or position than something/somebody
example: The water came above our knees.

definition: in or to a foreign country
example: to go/travel/live/study abroad

definition: the fact of somebody being away from a place where they are usually expected to be; the occasion or period of time when somebody is away
example: in somebody's absence, The decision was made in my absence (= while I was not there).

definition: not in a place because of illness, etc.
example: He was absent from work for two weeks.

definition: total and complete

definition: used to emphasize that something is completely true
example: You're absolutely right.

definition: to take in a liquid, gas or other substance from the surface or space around

definition: based on general ideas and not on any particular real person, thing or situation

definition: extremely silly; not logical and sensible

definition: a large quantity that is more than enough
example: The brochure promised beautiful walks with an abundance of wildlife.

definition: the use of something in a way that is wrong or harmful

definition: to make bad use of something, or to use so much of something that it harms your health
example: to abuse alcohol/drugs

definition: connected with education, especially studying in schools and universities

definition: a person who teaches and/or does research at a university or college

definition: a school or college for special training

definition: to happen faster or earlier; to make something happen faster or earlier

definition: a way of pronouncing the words of a language that shows which country, area or social class a person comes from; how well somebody pronounces a particular language
example: a northern/Dublin/Scottish accent

definition: to take willingly something that is offered; to say ‘yes’ to an offer, invitation, etc.

definition: agreed or approved of by most people in a society

definition: the act of accepting a gift, an invitation, an offer, etc.

definition: the opportunity or right to use something or to see somebody/something

definition: to open a computer file or use a computer system

definition: that can be reached, entered, used, seen, etc.

definition: an unpleasant event, especially in a vehicle, that happens unexpectedly and causes injury or damage

definition: by chance; in a way that was not planned

definition: to provide somebody with a room or place to sleep, live or sit

definition: a place to live, work or stay in

definition: to travel or go somewhere with somebody/something

definition: to succeed in doing or completing something

definition: an impressive thing that is done or achieved after a lot of work

definition: according to a rule or the way that somebody says that something should be done

definition: as stated or reported by somebody/something

definition: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

definition: an arrangement that somebody has with a bank, etc. to keep money there, take some out, etc.

definition: to have the opinion that somebody/something is a particular thing

definition: the fact of being responsible for your decisions or actions and expected to explain them when you are asked

definition: responsible for your decisions or actions and expected to explain them when you are asked

definition: a person whose job is to keep or check financial accounts

definition: to gradually get more and more of something over a period of time

definition: the process of gradually increasing or getting more and more of something over a period of time

definition: to say that somebody has done something wrong or is guilty of something

definition: to succeed in reaching a particular goal, status or standard, especially by making an effort for a long time

definition: a thing that somebody has done successfully, especially using their own effort and skill

definition: that contains acid or has the essential characteristics of an acid; that has a pH of less than seven

definition: a chemical, usually a liquid, that contains hydrogen and has a pH of less than seven. The hydrogen can be replaced by a metal to form a salt. Acids usually have a bitter sharp taste and can often burn holes in or damage things they touch.
example: The acid burned a hole in her coat.

definition: to accept that something is true

definition: to gain something by your own efforts, ability or behaviour

definition: the act of getting something, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.

definition: a unit for measuring an area of land; 4 840 square yards or about 4 050 square metres

definition: from one side to the other side

definition: from one side to the other side of something

definition: a particular thing that somebody does

definition: to do something for a particular purpose or in order to deal with a situation

definition: the process of doing something in order to make something happen or to deal with a situation

definition: to make something such as a device or chemical process start working

definition: the act of making something such as a device or chemical process start working

definition: a person who works to achieve political or social change, especially as a member of an organization with particular aims

definition: a thing that you do for interest or pleasure

definition: a notice, picture or film telling people about a product, job or service

definition: to change your behaviour in order to deal more successfully with a new situation

definition: the condition of being unable to stop using or doing something as a habit, especially something harmful

definition: to respect somebody for what they have done or to respect their qualities

definition: easy to see or understand

definition: according to what you have heard or read; according to the way something appears
example: Apparently they are getting divorced soon.

definition: a deeply felt request for money, help or information that is needed immediately, especially one made by a charity or by the police
example: appeal for something, to launch a TV appeal for donations to the charity

definition: to make a deeply felt request, especially for something that is needed immediately
example: I am appealing (= asking for money) on behalf of the famine victims.

definition: attractive or interesting
example: Spending the holidays in Britain wasn't a prospect that I found particularly appealing.

definition: to start to be seen
example: Three days later a rash appeared.

definition: the way that somebody/something looks on the outside; what somebody/something seems to be
example: the physical/outward/external appearance of something

definition: physical desire for food
example: He suffered from headaches and loss of appetite.

definition: to show your approval of somebody/something by clapping your hands (= hitting your open hands together several times)
example: He started to applaud and the others joined in.

definition: a round fruit with shiny red or green skin that is fairly hard and white inside
example: Peel and core the apples.

definition: that can be said to be true in the case of somebody/something
example: Give details of children where applicable (= if you have any).

definition: a person who makes a formal request for something (= applies for it), especially for a job, a place at a college or university, etc.
example: There were over 500 applicants for the job.

definition: a formal (often written) request for something, such as a job, permission to do something or a place at a college or university
example: a planning/patent/visa application

definition: to make a formal request, usually in writing, for something such as a job, a loan, permission for something, a place at a university, etc.
example: You should apply in person/by letter.

definition: to choose somebody for a job or position of responsibility
example: appoint somebody, They have appointed a new head teacher at my son's school.

definition: a formal arrangement to meet or visit somebody at a particular time, especially for a reason connected with their work
example: I've got a dental appointment at 3 o'clock.

definition: to recognize the good qualities of somebody/something
example: Over the years he came to appreciate the beauty and tranquillity of the river.

definition: pleasure that you have when you recognize and enjoy the good qualities of somebody/something
example: She shows little appreciation of good music.

definition: a way of dealing with somebody/something; a way of doing or thinking about something such as a problem or a task
example: She took the wrong approach in her dealings with them.

definition: to come near to somebody/something in distance or time
example: We could hear the train approaching.

definition: suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances
example: an appropriate response/measure/method

definition: in a way that is suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances
example: The government has been accused of not responding appropriately to the needs of the homeless.

definition: the feeling that somebody/something is good or acceptable; a positive opinion of somebody/something
example: She desperately wanted to win her father's approval.

definition: to think that somebody/something is good, acceptable or suitable
example: I told my mother I wanted to leave school but she didn't approve.

definition: used to show that something is almost, but not completely, accurate or correct
example: The journey took approximately seven hours.

definition: the fourth month of the year, between March and May
example: in April, She was born in April.

definition: not seeming to be based on a reason, system or plan and sometimes seeming unfair
example: The choice of players for the team seemed completely arbitrary.

definition: a person whose job is designing buildings

definition: relating to architecture and buildings

definition: a collection of historical documents or records of a government, a family, a place or an organization; the place where these records are stored

definition: part of a place, town, etc., or a region of a country or the world
example: to improve access to services in rural areas

definition: a place with a flat open area in the middle and seats around it where people can watch sports and entertainment
example: a concert at Wembley Arena

definition: used (often before a comparative or superlative adjective) when you are stating an opinion that you believe you could give reasons to support
example: He is arguably the best actor of his generation.

definition: to speak angrily to somebody because you disagree with them

definition: a conversation or discussion in which two or more people disagree, often angrily

definition: to happen; to start to exist

definition: either of the two long parts that stick out from the top of the body and connect the shoulders to the hands

definition: to provide weapons for yourself/somebody in order to fight a battle or a war

definition: involving the use of weapons

definition: weapons, especially as used by the army, navy, etc.

definition: a large organized group of soldiers who are trained to fight on land

definition: approximately

definition: surrounding somebody/something; on each side of something

definition: to plan or organize something in advance
example: arrange something, The party was arranged quickly.

definition: a plan or preparation that you make so that something can happen

definition: a group or collection of things or people, often one that is large or impressive
example: a vast array of bottles of different shapes and sizes

definition: the act of arresting somebody
example: The police made several arrests.

definition: if the police arrest somebody, the person is taken to a police station and kept there because the police believe they may be guilty of a crime
example: arrest somebody, A man has been arrested in connection with the robbery.

definition: an act of coming or being brought to a place

definition: to get to a place, especially at the end of a journey

definition: a thin stick with a sharp point at one end, which is shot from a bow

definition: the use of the imagination to express ideas or feelings, particularly in painting, drawing or sculpture

definition: a piece of writing about a particular subject in a newspaper or magazine, on a website, etc.

definition: to express or explain your thoughts or feelings clearly in words

definition: made or produced to copy something natural; not real
example: an artificial limb/flower/sweetener/fertilizer

definition: a person who creates works of art, especially paintings or drawings

definition: connected with art or artists
example: the artistic works of the period

definition: pictures and photographs prepared for books, magazines, etc.

definition: used when you are comparing two people or things, or two situations

definition: while something else is happening

definition: used to describe somebody/something appearing to be somebody/something else

definition: the grey or black powder that is left after something, especially tobacco, wood or coal, has burnt
example: cigarette ash

definition: feeling shame or feeling embarrassed about somebody/something or because of something you have done

definition: to one side; out of the way

definition: to say or write something in the form of a question, in order to get information

definition: sleeping

definition: a particular part or feature of a situation, an idea, a problem, etc.; a way in which it may be considered

definition: a strong desire to have or do something

definition: to have a strong desire to achieve or to become something

definition: the murder of an important or famous person, especially for political reasons

definition: the crime of attacking somebody physically

definition: to attack somebody violently, especially when this is a crime

definition: to come together as a group; to bring people or things together as a group

definition: a group of people who have been elected to meet together regularly and make decisions or laws for a particular region or country

definition: to state clearly and definitely that something is true

definition: to make a judgement about the nature or quality of somebody/something

definition: an opinion or a judgement about somebody/something that has been thought about very carefully

definition: a person or thing that is valuable or useful to somebody/something

definition: to give somebody something that they can use, or some work or responsibility

definition: a task or piece of work that somebody is given to do, usually as part of their job or studies

definition: to help somebody to do something

definition: help or support

definition: having a rank below that of a senior person and helping them in their work

definition: a person who helps or supports somebody, usually in their job

definition: to make a connection between people or things in your mind

definition: if one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected because they happen together or one thing causes the other

definition: an official group of people who have joined together for a particular purpose

definition: to think or accept that something is true but without having proof of it

definition: a belief or feeling that something is true or that something will happen, although there is no proof

definition: to tell somebody that something is definitely true or is definitely going to happen, especially when they have doubts about it

definition: very surprising; difficult to believe

definition: protection that a government gives to people who have left their own country, usually because they were in danger for political reasons

definition: used to say where something/somebody is or where something happens

definition: a person who competes in sports

definition: the 8th month of the year, between July and September

definition: without skill or care

definition: an arrangement to risk money, etc. on the result of a particular event; the money that you risk in this way

definition: to give information about somebody/something to an enemy

definition: of a higher standard or less poor quality; not as bad as something else

definition: in a more excellent or pleasant way; not as badly

definition: in the space or period of time separating two or more points, objects, etc. or two dates, events, etc.

definition: in or into the space separating two or more points, objects, people, etc.

definition: on or to the further side of something

definition: a road vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing the pedals with your feet

definition: to offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an auction

definition: large in size, degree, amount, etc.

definition: a bicycle

definition: a document that shows how much you owe somebody for goods or services

definition: to send somebody a bill for something

definition: 1 000 000 000; one thousand million

definition: the time when a baby is born; the process of being born

definition: the day in each year which is the same date as the one on which you were born

definition: a senior priest in charge of the work of the Church in a city or district

definition: having a strong, unpleasant taste; not sweet

definition: very strange or unusual

definition: having the very darkest colour, like coal or the sky at night

definition: the very darkest colour, like night or coal

definition: the flat part of a knife, tool or machine, which has a sharp edge or edges for cutting

definition: responsibility for doing something badly or wrongly; saying that somebody is responsible for something

definition: empty, with nothing written, printed or recorded on it

definition: a large cover, often made of wool, used especially on beds to keep people warm

definition: to violently destroy or break something into pieces, using explosives

definition: to lose blood, especially from a wound or an injury

definition: to mix two or more substances together

definition: to ask God to protect somebody/something

definition: to stop something from moving or flowing through a pipe, a passage, a road, etc. by putting something in it or across it

definition: pale gold in colour

definition: the red liquid that flows through the bodies of humans and animals

definition: a hard hit with the hand, a weapon, etc.

definition: to send out air from the mouth

definition: having the colour of a clear sky or the sea on a clear day

definition: the colour of a clear sky or the sea on a clear day

definition: a long thin piece of strong hard material, especially wood, used, for example, for making floors, building walls and roofs and making boats

definition: to get on a ship, train, plane, bus, etc.

definition: the whole physical structure of a human or an animal

definition: when a liquid boils or when you boil it, it is heated to the point where it forms bubbles and turns to steam or vapour

definition: brave and confident; not afraid to say what you feel or to take risks

definition: something that forms a connection between people or groups, such as a feeling of friendship or shared ideas and experiences

definition: any of the hard parts that form the skeleton of the body of a human or an animal

definition: a strong shoe that covers the foot and ankle and often the lower part of the leg

definition: feeling tired and impatient because you have lost interest in somebody/something or because you have nothing to do

definition: used with plural nouns to mean ‘the two’ or ‘the one as well as the other’

definition: used with plural nouns to mean ‘the two’ or ‘the one as well as the other’

definition: to spend time and/or energy doing something

definition: a glass or plastic container, usually round with straight sides and a narrow neck, used especially for storing liquids

definition: in the lowest, last or furthest place or position

definition: the smallest unit of living matter that can exist on its own. All plants and animals are made up of cells.

definition: an area of land used for burying dead people, especially one that is not next to a church

definition: a coin and unit of money worth 1% of the main unit of money in many countries, for example of the US dollar or of the euro
example: A one-minute phone call to the UK cost 10 cents.

definition: in the centre of an area or object
example: central London

definition: the middle point or part of something

definition: to be the person or thing around which most activity takes place; to make somebody/something the central person or thing
example: centre around/round somebody/something, State occasions always centred around the king.

definition: a period of 100 years
example: A century ago, Valparaiso was the country's main port.

definition: a public or religious occasion that includes a series of formal or traditional actions

definition: strongly believing something; having no doubts

definition: without doubt

definition: the state of being certain
example: There is no certainty that the president's removal would end the civil war.

definition: an official document that may be used to prove that the facts it states are true
example: a birth/marriage/death certificate

definition: a series of connected metal rings, used for pulling or fastening things; a length of chain used for a particular purpose

definition: to fasten something with a chain; to fasten somebody/something to another person or thing with a chain, so that they do not escape or get stolen

definition: a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, with a back, a seat and four legs

definition: the person in charge of a meeting, who tells people when they can speak, etc.

definition: a new or difficult task that tests somebody’s ability and skill

definition: a hall in a public building that is used for formal meetings

definition: the act or result of something becoming different

definition: a complete lack of order

definition: a separate section of a book, usually with a number or title

definition: a person or an animal in a book, play or film

definition: to be typical of a person, place or thing

definition: to ask an amount of money for goods or a service

definition: an organization for helping people in need

definition: the power of pleasing or attracting people

definition: a large bird that is often kept for its eggs or meat

definition: a person with a high rank or the highest rank in a company or an organization

definition: a young human who is not yet an adult

definition: a group of people who sing together, for example in church services or public performances

definition: lasting for a long time; difficult to cure

definition: made of concrete

definition: building material that is made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones and water
example: a slab of concrete

definition: to say very strongly that you think something is bad, usually for moral reasons
example: condemn somebody/something, The government issued a statement condemning the killings.

definition: the state that something is in
example: in… condition, to be in pristine/excellent/perfect condition

definition: a person’s behaviour in a particular place or in a particular situation
example: The sport has a strict code of conduct.

definition: to organize and/or do a particular activity
example: to conduct an experiment/inquiry/investigation/interview

definition: to discuss something with somebody, in order to exchange opinions or get advice
example: He wanted to confer with his colleagues before reaching a decision.

definition: a large official meeting, usually lasting for a few days, at which people with the same work or interests come together to discuss their views
example: The hotel is used for exhibitions, conferences and social events.

definition: to admit, especially formally or to the police, that you have done something wrong or illegal
example: After hours of questioning, the suspect confessed.

definition: a statement that a person makes, admitting that they are guilty of a crime; the act of making such a statement
example: After hours of questioning by police, she made a full confession.

definition: the feeling that you can trust, believe in and be sure about the abilities or good qualities of somebody/something
example: The president's actions hardly inspire confidence.

definition: feeling sure about your own ability to do things and be successful
example: She was in a relaxed, confident mood.

definition: an arrangement of the parts of something or a group of things; the form or shape that this arrangement produces
example: configuration of something, The design is based on four configurations of squares.

definition: to keep somebody/something inside the limits of a particular activity, subject, area, etc.
example: be confined to (doing) something, The work will not be confined to the Glasgow area.

definition: to state or show that something is definitely true or correct, especially by providing evidence
example: confirm something, His guilty expression confirmed my suspicions.

definition: a statement, letter, etc. that shows that something is true, correct or definite
example: I'm still waiting for confirmation of the test results.

definition: a situation in which people, groups or countries disagree strongly or are involved in a serious argument
example: The violence was the result of political conflicts.

definition: if two ideas, beliefs, stories, etc. conflict, it is not possible for them to exist together or for them both to be true
example: Reports conflicted on how much of the aid was reaching the famine victims.

definition: to appear and need to be dealt with by somebody
example: What is to be done about the economic problems confronting the country?

definition: a situation in which there is anger between people or groups who disagree because they have different opinions
example: confrontation (with somebody), She wanted to avoid another confrontation with her father.

definition: to make somebody unable to think clearly or understand something

definition: unable to think clearly or to understand what is happening or what somebody is saying
example: I'm confused—say all that again.

definition: difficult to understand; not clear
example: The instructions on the box are very confusing.

definition: a state of not being certain about what is happening, what you should do, what something means, etc.
example: The announcement caused a lot of confusion.

definition: to tell somebody that you are pleased about their success or achievements
example: I congratulated them all on their results.

definition: a group of people who are gathered together in a church for a religious service, not including the priest and choir
example: The congregation stood to sing the hymn.

definition: related to or belonging to a congress or the Congress in the US
example: a congressional committee/bill

definition: to join together two or more things; to be joined together
example: connect A and B, The towns are connected by train and bus services.

definition: (of two or more things or people) having a link between them
example: We do not believe that the incidents are connected.

definition: something that connects two facts, ideas, etc.
example: connection between A and B, Scientists have established a connection between cholesterol levels and heart disease.

definition: to take control of a country or city and its people by force
example: The Normans conquered England in 1066.

definition: the part of your mind that tells you whether your actions are right or wrong
example: to have a clear/guilty conscience (= to feel that you have done right/wrong)

definition: aware of something; noticing something
example: conscious of something, She's very conscious of the problems involved.

definition: the state of being able to use your senses and mental powers to understand what is happening
example: I can't remember any more—I must have lost consciousness.

definition: following one after another in a continuous series
example: She was absent for nine consecutive days.

definition: an opinion that all members of a group agree with

definition: permission to do something, especially given by somebody in authority

definition: to agree to something or give your permission for something

definition: a result of something that has happened, especially an unpleasant result

definition: as a result; therefore

definition: the protection of the natural environment
example: to be interested in wildlife conservation

definition: opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values

definition: a conservative person

definition: to protect something and prevent it from being changed or destroyed

definition: to think about something carefully, especially in order to make a decision

definition: great in amount, size, importance, etc.

definition: much; a lot

definition: the act of thinking carefully about something

definition: the quality of always behaving in the same way or of having the same opinions, standard, etc.; the quality of being consistent

definition: always behaving in the same way, or having the same opinions, standards, etc.

definition: always the same

definition: to make a position of power or success stronger so that it is more likely to continue

definition: a secret plan by a group of people to do something harmful or illegal

definition: happening all the time or repeatedly

definition: to be considered to be something

definition: a thing that limits something, or limits your freedom to do something

definition: to go to somebody for information or advice

example: a technology/design consultant

definition: the act of discussing something with somebody or with a group of people before making a decision about it

definition: to use something, especially fuel, energy or time

definition: if something contains something else, it has that thing inside it or as part of it

definition: a box, bottle, etc. in which something can be stored or transported

definition: to think about whether you should do something, or how you should do something

definition: a person or team with a chance of winning a competition

definition: happy and satisfied with what you have

definition: the things that are contained in something

definition: anger between people who disagree

definition: a competition in which people try to win something

definition: the situation in which something happens and that helps you to understand it

definition: one of the large land masses of the earth such as Europe, Asia or Africa

definition: in a way that is repeated many times so that it is annoying

definition: an official written agreement

definition: to become less or smaller; to make something become less or smaller

definition: father

definition: happening, done or produced every day
example: Many people still read a daily newspaper.

definition: every day
example: The machines are inspected twice daily.

definition: made from milk
example: dairy products/produce

definition: milk, cheese and other milk products
example: The doctor told me to eat less red meat and dairy.

definition: a barrier that is built across a river in order to stop the water from flowing, used especially to make a reservoir (= a lake for storing water) or to produce electricity
example: the Narmada dam in India

definition: physical harm caused to something which makes it less attractive, useful or valuable
example: serious/severe damage

definition: to have a bad or harmful effect on something/somebody
example: The church was badly damaged by the 1997 earthquake.

definition: causing damage; having a bad effect on somebody/something
example: damaging consequences/effects

definition: a series of movements and steps that are usually performed to music; a particular example of these movements and steps
example: Do you know any other Latin American dances?

definition: to move your body to the sound and rhythm of music
example: Do you want to dance?

definition: a person who dances or whose job is dancing
example: She's a fantastic dancer.

definition: moving your body to music
example: There was music and dancing till two in the morning.

definition: the possibility of something happening that will injure, harm or kill somebody, or damage or destroy something
example: Danger! Keep Out!

definition: likely to injure or harm somebody, or to damage or destroy something
example: The situation is extremely dangerous.

definition: to be brave enough to do something
example: She said it as loudly as she dared.

definition: with no or very little light, especially because it is night
example: a dark room/street/forest/night

definition: the lack of light in a place, especially because it is night
example: Are the children afraid of the dark?

definition: the state of being dark, without any light
example: After a few minutes our eyes got used to the darkness.

definition: facts or information, especially when examined and used to find out things or to make decisions
example: We collected publicly available data over a 10-day period.

definition: an organized set of data that is stored in a computer and can be looked at and used in various ways
example: The database is updated monthly.

definition: a particular day of the month, sometimes in a particular year, given in numbers and words
example: ‘What's the date today?’ ‘The 10th.’

definition: to write or print the date on something
example: Thank you for your letter dated 24th March.

definition: a person’s female child
example: We have two sons and a daughter.

definition: the time of day when light first appears
example: at dawn, They start work at dawn.

definition: a period of 24 hours
example: ‘What day is it today?’ ‘Monday.’

definition: no longer alive
example: My mother's dead; she died in 2017.

definition: a point in time by which something must be done
example: I prefer to work to a deadline.

definition: causing or likely to cause death
example: a deadly weapon/disease

definition: an agreement, especially in business, on particular conditions for buying or doing something
example: to sign/strike/finalize/close a deal

definition: to give cards to each player in a game of cards
example: Whose turn is it to deal?

definition: a person whose business is buying and selling a particular product
example: an art/antique dealer

definition: used at the beginning of a letter before the name or title of the person that you are writing to
example: Dear Sir or Madam

definition: used in expressions that show that you are surprised, upset, annoyed or worried
example: Oh dear! I think I've lost my purse!

definition: the fact of somebody dying or being killed
example: the anniversary of his wife’s death

definition: a formal discussion of an issue at a public meeting or in a parliament. In a debate two or more speakers express opposite views and then there is often a vote on the issue.
example: the first ever televised presidential debate

definition: to discuss something, especially formally, before making a decision or finding a solution
example: debate (something), Politicians will be debating the bill later this week.

definition: pieces of wood, metal, building materials, etc. that are left after something has been destroyed
example: Emergency teams are still clearing the debris from the plane crash.

definition: a sum of money that somebody owes
example: to pay/repay a debt

definition: the first public appearance of a performer or sports player
example: He will make his debut for the first team this week.

definition: a period of ten years, especially a continuous period, such as 1910–1919 or 2000–2009
example: the early decades of the nineteenth century

definition: the 12th and last month of the year
example: She was born in December.

definition: of a good enough standard or quality
example: a decent meal/place to live

definition: to think carefully about the different possibilities that are available and choose one of them
example: It's up to you to decide.

definition: a choice or judgement that you make after thinking and talking about what is the best thing to do
example: I think I've made the right decision.

definition: the process of deciding about something important, especially in a group of people or in an organization
example: responsibility for decision-making

definition: very important for the final result of a particular situation
example: a decisive factor/victory/battle

definition: the top outside floor of a ship or boat
example: on deck, I was the only person on deck at that time of night.

definition: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement
example: to issue/sign a declaration

definition: to say something officially or publicly
example: declare something, The government has declared a state of emergency.

definition: a continuous decrease in the number, value, quality, etc. of something
example: decline in something, There has been a 5 per cent decline in student numbers.

definition: to become smaller, fewer, weaker, etc.
example: Support for the party continues to decline.

definition: to make something look more attractive by putting things on it
example: decorate something with something, They decorated the room with flowers and balloons.

definition: a thing that makes something look more attractive on special occasions
example: Christmas/festive decorations

definition: the process of reducing something; the amount that something is reduced by
example: Sales for May show a decrease compared with the same month last year.

definition: to become smaller in size, number, etc.; to make something smaller in size, number, etc.
example: Donations have decreased significantly over the past few years.

definition: working hard at something because it is very important to you
example: a dedicated teacher

definition: the hard work and effort that somebody puts into an activity or a purpose because they think it is important
example: hard work and dedication

definition: a thing that somebody does that is usually very good or very bad
example: It's a stirring tale of heroic deeds.

definition: to have a particular opinion about somebody/something
example: deem somebody/something + noun, The evening was deemed a great success.

definition: having a large distance from the top or surface to the bottom
example: a deep hole/well/river

definition: a long way below the surface of something or a long way inside or into something
example: Dig deeper!

definition: very; very much
example: She is deeply religious.

definition: what happens or appears if you do not make any other choice or change, especially in a computer program
example: The default is fifty lines.

definition: failure to win or to be successful
example: The party faces defeat in the election.

definition: to win against somebody in a war, competition, sports game, etc.
example: defeat somebody/something, He defeated the champion in three sets.

definition: a fault in something or in the way it has been made that means that it is not perfect
example: a defect in the glass

definition: the act of protecting somebody/something from attack, criticism, etc.
example: in defence of somebody/something, soldiers who died in defence of their country

definition: to protect somebody/something from attack
example: defend somebody/something, The role of the military is to defend the country.

definition: a player who must stop the other team from scoring in games such as football (soccer), hockey, etc.
example: a passionate defender of human rights

definition: protecting somebody/something against attack
example: As a defensive measure he built a series of coastal forts and watchtowers.

definition: the state of not having, or not having enough of, something that is essential
example: deficiency (in something), Vitamin deficiency in the diet can cause illness.

definition: the amount by which money spent or owed is greater than money earned in a particular period of time
example: a budget/trade deficit

definition: to say or explain what the meaning of a word or phrase is
example: define something, The term ‘normal’ is difficult to define.

definition: sure or certain; unlikely to change
example: Can you give me a definite answer by tomorrow?

definition: a way of emphasizing that something is true and that there is no doubt about it
example: I definitely remember sending the letter.

definition: an explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase, especially in a dictionary
example: The dictionary provides clear, simple definitions.

definition: to refuse to obey or show respect for somebody in authority, a law, a rule, etc.
example: I wouldn't have dared to defy my teachers.

definition: a unit for measuring temperature
example: at… degrees, Water freezes at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (32°F) or zero/nought degrees Celsius (0°C).

definition: a period of time when somebody/something has to wait because of a problem that makes something slow or late
example: Commuters will face long delays on the roads today.

definition: to make somebody/something late or force them to do something more slowly
example: My flight was delayed.

definition: a person who is chosen or elected to represent the views of a group of people and vote and make decisions for them
example: Congress delegates rejected the proposals.

definition: a group of people who represent the views of an organization, a country, etc.
example: the Dutch delegation to the United Nations

definition: to remove something that has been written or printed, or that has been stored on a computer
example: Your name has been deleted from the list.

definition: done on purpose rather than by accident
example: a deliberate act of vandalism

definition: done in a way that was planned, not by chance
example: She's been deliberately ignoring him all day.

definition: easily damaged or broken
example: delicate china teacups

definition: having a very pleasant taste or smell
example: Who cooked this? It's absolutely delicious.

definition: a feeling of great pleasure
example: a feeling of sheer/pure delight

definition: to give somebody a lot of pleasure and joy
example: This news will delight his fans all over the world.

definition: very pleased
example: a delighted smile

definition: to take goods, letters, etc. to the person or people they have been sent to
example: deliver something, I get my food delivered from the supermarket to save time.

definition: the act of taking goods, letters, etc. to the people they have been sent to
example: Allow 28 days for delivery.

definition: a very strong request for something; something that somebody needs
example: demand for something, a demand for higher pay

definition: to make a very strong request for something
example: demand something, They are demanding the release of all political prisoners.

definition: a system of government in which the people of a country can vote to elect their representatives
example: parliamentary democracy

definition: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country; connected with this system
example: a democratic country

definition: an evil spirit
example: The people believed the girl was possessed by demons.

definition: to show something clearly by giving proof or evidence
example: demonstrate that…, New research convincingly demonstrates that age-related memory loss is not inevitable.

definition: a public meeting or a march (= an organized walk by many people) at which people show that they are protesting against or supporting somebody/something
example: to take part in/go on a demonstration

definition: a statement that something is not true or does not exist; the action of denying something
example: denial (of something), the prisoner’s repeated denials of the charges against him

definition: to strongly criticize somebody/something that you think is wrong, illegal, etc.
example: denounce somebody/something, She publicly denounced the government's handling of the crisis.

definition: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them
example: a dense crowd/forest

definition: the quality of being dense; the degree to which something is dense
example: The population density in this city is very high.

definition: a person whose job is to take care of people’s teeth
example: to see/visit/consult your dentist

definition: to say that something is not true
example: deny something, to deny an allegation/a charge/an accusation

definition: to leave a place, especially to start a trip
example: depart (for…) (from…), Flights for Rome depart from Terminal 3.

definition: a section of a large organization such as a government, business, university, etc.

definition: an act of leaving a place
example: His sudden departure threw the office into chaos.

definition: according to
example: Starting salary varies from £26 000 to £30 500, depending on experience.

definition: the state of needing the help and support of somebody/something in order to survive or be successful
example: Our relationship was based on mutual dependence.

definition: needing somebody/something in order to survive or be successful

definition: to show an image of somebody/something in a picture
example: depict somebody/something (as somebody/something), a painting depicting the Virgin and Child

definition: to move soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action

definition: the act of moving soldiers or weapons into a position where they are ready for military action

definition: a sum of money that is given as the first part of a larger payment

definition: to put money into a bank account
example: Millions were deposited in Swiss bank accounts.

definition: very sad and without hope
example: You mustn't let yourself get depressed.

definition: making you feel very sad and without enthusiasm
example: a depressing sight/thought/experience

definition: a medical condition in which a person feels very sad, anxious and without hope and often has physical symptoms such as being unable to sleep, etc.
example: She was diagnosed as having clinical depression.

definition: the distance from the top or surface to the bottom of something; a particular distance down from the surface of something
example: depth of something, What's the depth of the water here?

definition: a person who is the next most important person below a business manager, a head of a school, a political leader, etc. and who does that person’s job when they are away

definition: to come or go down from a higher to a lower level

definition: an action of coming or going down
example: The plane began its descent to Heathrow.

definition: to say what somebody/something is like

definition: a piece of writing or speech that says what somebody/something is like; the act of writing or saying in words what somebody/something is like

definition: a large area of land that has very little water and very few plants growing on it. Many deserts are covered by sand.
example: the Sahara Desert

definition: to leave somebody without help or support
example: She was deserted by her husband.

definition: to do something or show qualities that mean a particular reaction, reward or punishment is appropriate

definition: the general arrangement of the different parts of something that is made, such as a building, book, machine, etc.

definition: to decide how something will look, work, etc., by drawing plans, making computer models, etc.

definition: to say officially that somebody/something has a particular character or name; to describe somebody/something in a particular way

definition: a person whose job is to decide how things such as clothes, furniture, tools, etc. will look or work by making drawings, plans or patterns

definition: that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing

definition: a strong wish to have or do something
example: He now had enough money to satisfy all his desires.

definition: to want something; to wish for something
example: desire something, We all desire health and happiness.

definition: a piece of furniture like a table, often with drawers (= parts like boxes in it with handles on the front for pulling them open), that you sit at to read, write, work, etc.
example: at a desk, I spend all day sitting at a desk.

definition: a screen on a computer that shows the icons of programs and files that can be used
example: desktop icons

definition: feeling or showing that you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or others

definition: in a way that shows you have little hope and are ready to do anything without worrying about danger to yourself or others

definition: used to show that something happened or is true although something else might have happened to prevent it

definition: a place to which somebody/something is going or being sent

definition: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists, works, etc.

definition: the act of destroying something; the process of being destroyed

definition: causing destruction or damage

definition: a small individual fact or item; a less important fact or item

definition: to give a list of facts or all the available information about something

definition: giving many details and a lot of information; paying great attention to details

definition: to keep somebody in an official place, such as a police station, a prison or a hospital, and prevent them from leaving

definition: to discover or notice something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.

definition: the process of discovering or noticing something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.; the fact of being discovered or noticed

definition: to become worse
example: Her health deteriorated rapidly, and she died shortly afterwards.

definition: the quality that makes you continue trying to do something even when this is difficult
example: fierce/grim/dogged determination

definition: to discover the facts about something; to calculate something exactly

definition: having made a definite decision to do something and not letting anyone prevent you

definition: to completely destroy a place or an area
example: The bomb devastated much of the old part of the city.

definition: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make something do this

definition: the steady growth of something so that it becomes more advanced, stronger, etc.

definition: an object or a piece of equipment that has been designed to do a particular job
example: a tracking/recording/listening device

definition: the most powerful evil being

definition: to invent something new or a new way of doing something

definition: to say exactly what an illness or the cause of a problem is

definition: a simple drawing using lines to explain where something is, how something works, etc.

definition: a conversation in a book, play or film or in language teaching materials
example: Learners are asked to listen to three short dialogues.

definition: a clear precious stone of pure carbon, the hardest substance known. Diamonds are used in jewellery and also in industry, especially for cutting glass.
example: a diamond ring/necklace

definition: a book in which you can write down the experiences you have each day, your private thoughts, etc.
example: Do you keep a diary (= write one regularly)?

definition: to tell somebody what to do, especially in an annoying way
example: dictate something (to somebody), They are in no position to dictate terms (= tell other people what to do).

definition: a political leader who has complete power over a country, especially one who has gained it using military force
example: The country suffered at the hands of a series of military dictators.

definition: a book or electronic resource that gives a list of the words of a language in alphabetical order and explains what they mean, or gives a word for them in a foreign language
example: a Spanish-English dictionary

definition: to stop living
example: My father died suddenly at the age of 48.

definition: the food and drink that you eat and drink regularly
example: to eat a healthy, balanced diet

definition: to be different from somebody/something

definition: the way in which two people or things are not like each other; the way in which somebody/something has changed
example: Americans and Brits speak the same language, but there are big cultural differences.

definition: not the same as somebody/something; not like somebody/something else
example: different from somebody/something, American English is significantly different from British English.

definition: to recognize or show that two things are not the same
example: differentiate (between) A and B, It's difficult to differentiate between the two varieties.

definition: in a different way from somebody/something
example: Boys and girls may behave differently.

definition: not easy; needing effort or skill to do or to understand
example: The competition judges were given a very difficult task.

definition: a problem; a thing or situation that causes problems

definition: to make a hole in the ground or to move soil from one place to another using your hands, a tool or a machine
example: I think I'll do some digging in the garden.

definition: using a system of receiving and sending information as a series of the numbers one and zero, showing that an electronic signal is there or is not there
example: a digital camera

definition: a calm and serious manner that deserves respect
example: She accepted the criticism with quiet dignity.

definition: a situation that makes problems, often one in which you have to make a very difficult choice between things of equal importance
example: I could see no way of resolving this moral dilemma.

definition: a measurement in space, for example how high, wide or long something is
example: We measured the dimensions of the kitchen.

definition: to become smaller, weaker, etc.; to make something become smaller, weaker, etc.

definition: the main meal of the day, eaten either in the middle of the day or in the evening
example: It's time for dinner.

definition: to put something quickly into a liquid and take it out again
example: dip something (into something), He dipped the brush into the paint.

definition: a person whose job is to represent his or her country in a foreign country, for example, in an embassy
example: Washington's top diplomat in Havana

definition: connected with managing relations between countries (= diplomacy)

definition: going in the straightest line between two places without stopping or changing direction

definition: without stopping or changing direction or vehicle

definition: to control or be in charge of somebody/something
example: He was asked to take command and direct operations.

definition: the general position a person or thing moves or points towards

definition: without stopping or changing direction
example: The path leads directly to the river.

definition: one of a group of senior managers who run a company
example: a non-executive director

definition: a book or electronic resource containing lists of information, usually in alphabetical order, for example people’s phone numbers or the names and addresses of businesses in a particular area
example: a telephone/trade directory

definition: any substance that makes something dirty, for example dust, soil or mud
example: His clothes were covered in dirt.

definition: not clean
example: dirty hands/clothes/dishes

definition: a physical or mental condition that makes it difficult for somebody to do some things that most other people can do
example: a physical/developmental/intellectual disability

definition: having a condition that makes it difficult for you to do some things that most other people can do
example: physically/developmentally/intellectually disabled

definition: something that causes problems and tends to stop somebody/something from succeeding or making progress
example: a serious/severe/significant disadvantage

definition: if two people disagree or one person disagrees with another about something, they have a different opinion about it

definition: a situation where people have different opinions about something and often argue
example: disagreement (about/on/over/as to something), Disagreement arose about exactly how to plan the show.

definition: to become impossible to see
example: With that, Matt promptly disappeared.

definition: to make somebody feel sad because something that they hope for or expect to happen does not happen or is not as good as they hoped
example: disappoint (somebody), Her decision to cancel the concert is bound to disappoint her fans.

definition: upset because something you hoped for has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected
example: The singer has promised to refund any disappointed fans.

definition: not as good, successful, etc. as you had hoped; making you feel disappointed
example: a disappointing result/performance/defeat

definition: the feeling of being sad because something has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected or hoped
example: Book early for the show to avoid disappointment.

definition: an unexpected event, such as a very bad accident, a flood or a fire, that kills a lot of people or causes a lot of damage
example: the world's worst humanitarian disaster

definition: very bad, harmful or unsuccessful
example: a disastrous harvest/fire/result

definition: a thin flat round object
example: He wears an identity disc around his neck.

definition: to get rid of something that you no longer want or need
example: discard somebody/something, The room was littered with discarded newspapers.

definition: to give somebody official permission to leave the police or the armed forces; to make somebody leave the police or the armed forces
example: be discharged from something, He was discharged from the army following his injury.

definition: the practice of training people to obey rules and orders and punishing them if they do not; the controlled behaviour or situation that is the result of this training
example: The school has a reputation for high standards of discipline.

definition: to give somebody information about something, especially something that was previously secret

definition: the act of making something known or public that was previously secret or private
example: the newspaper’s disclosure of defence secrets

definition: an amount of money that is taken off the usual cost of something

definition: to take an amount of money off the usual cost of something; to sell something at a discount
example: be discounted by something, Most of our stock has been discounted by up to 40 per cent.

definition: to try to prevent something or to prevent somebody from doing something, especially by making it difficult to do or by showing that you do not approve of it
example: discourage (doing) something, a campaign to discourage smoking among teenagers

definition: a long and serious treatment or discussion of a subject in speech or writing
example: discourse on something, a discourse on issues of gender and sexuality

definition: to be the first person to become aware that a particular place or thing exists
example: Cook is credited with discovering Hawaii.

definition: an act or the process of finding somebody/something, or learning about something that was not known about before
example: Researchers in this field have made some important new discoveries.

definition: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation
example: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion.

definition: the practice of treating somebody or a particular group in society less fairly than others
example: age/racial/gender/sex discrimination (= because of somebody’s age, race or sex)

definition: to talk about something with somebody, especially in order to decide something
example: discuss something with somebody, Have you discussed the problem with anyone?

definition: a conversation about somebody/something; the process of discussing somebody/something
example: I discovered something interesting during a family discussion.

definition: an illness affecting humans, animals or plants, often caused by infection
example: heart/lung/liver disease

definition: a flat shallow container for cooking food in or serving it from
example: a baking/serving dish

definition: not honest; intending to trick people
example: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.

definition: a thin flat round object
example: Red blood cells are roughly the shape of a disk.

definition: a feeling of not liking somebody/something
example: dislike of somebody/something, He did not try to hide his dislike of his boss.

definition: to not like somebody/something
example: dislike somebody/something, Why do you dislike him so much?

definition: to decide that somebody/something is not important and not worth thinking or talking about
example: dismiss somebody/something, to dismiss a suggestion/a claim/an idea

definition: the act of dismissing somebody from their job; an example of this
example: He still hopes to win his claim against unfair dismissal.

definition: a condition or illness that causes problems with the way part of the body or brain works
example: a blood/bowel disorder

definition: to take the place of somebody/something
example: be displaced (by somebody/something), Gradually factory workers have been displaced by machines.

definition: an arrangement of things in a public place to inform or entertain people or advertise something for sale
example: a beautiful floral display

definition: to put something in a place where people can see it easily; to show something to people
example: display something, The exhibition gives local artists an opportunity to display their work.

definition: the act of getting rid of something
example: The council is responsible for waste disposal and street cleaning.

definition: to arrange things or people in a particular way or position
example: The visitors disposed themselves in a circle round the statue.

definition: an argument between two people, groups or countries; discussion about a subject on which people disagree
example: industrial/pay disputes

definition: to question whether something is true or legally or officially acceptable
example: dispute something, These figures have been disputed.

definition: to make it difficult for something to continue in the normal way
example: Demonstrators succeeded in disrupting the meeting.

definition: a situation in which it is difficult for something to continue in the normal way; the act of stopping something from continuing in the normal way
example: We aim to help you move house with minimum disruption to yourself.

definition: to mix with a liquid and become part of it
example: Salt dissolves in water.

definition: the amount of space between two places or things
example: a short/long distance

definition: far away in space or time
example: the distant sound of music

definition: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.
example: There was a distinct smell of gas.

definition: a clear difference or contrast especially between people or things that are similar or related
example: distinctions between traditional and modern societies

definition: having a quality or characteristic that makes something different and easily noticed
example: clothes with a distinctive style

definition: to recognize the difference between two people or things
example: distinguish between A and B, At what age are children able to distinguish between right and wrong?

definition: to change the shape, appearance or sound of something so that it is strange or not clear
example: a fairground mirror that distorts your shape

definition: to take somebody’s attention away from what they are trying to do
example: You're distracting me from my work.

definition: a feeling of great worry or unhappiness; great mental pain

definition: to be the same in size, quantity, value, etc. as something else
example: 2x plus y equals 7 (= 2x+y=7)

definition: the fact of being equal in rights, status, advantages, etc.
example: racial/social/gender equality

definition: to the same degree; in the same or in a similar way
example: Diet and exercise are equally important.

definition: a statement showing that two amounts or values are equal, for example 2x + y = 54
example: the numbers on the right-hand side of the equation

definition: to provide yourself/somebody/something with the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity
example: equip something, to be fully/poorly equipped

definition: the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity
example: a useful piece of equipment for the kitchen

definition: equal in value, amount, meaning, importance, etc.
example: 250 grams or an equivalent amount in ounces

definition: a thing, amount, word, etc. that is equal in value, meaning or purpose to something else
example: Send €20 or the equivalent in your own currency.

definition: a period of time, usually in history, that is different from other periods because of particular characteristics or events
example: the Victorian/modern/post-war era

definition: to build something
example: The church was erected in 1582.

definition: a mistake, especially one that causes problems or affects the result of something

definition: when a volcano erupts or burning rocks, smoke, etc. erupt or are erupted, the burning rocks, etc. are thrown out from the volcano

definition: to become greater, worse, more serious, etc.; to make something greater, worse, more serious, etc.

definition: the act or a method of escaping from a place or an unpleasant or dangerous situation

definition: to get away from a place where you have been kept as a prisoner or not allowed to leave

definition: more with one person, thing, etc. than with others, or more in particular circumstances than in others

definition: a short piece of writing by a student as part of a course of study
example: I have to write an essay this weekend.

definition: the most important quality or feature of something, that makes it what it is

definition: completely necessary; extremely important in a particular situation or for a particular activity
example: an essential part/feature of something

definition: when you think about the true, important or basic nature of somebody/something

definition: to start or create an organization, a system, etc. that is meant to last for a long time

definition: an organization, a large institution or a hotel

definition: an area of land with a lot of houses or factories of the same type on it

definition: a judgement that you make without having the exact details or figures about the size, amount, cost, etc. of something

definition: to form an idea of the cost, size, value etc. of something, but without calculating it exactly

definition: without an end; existing or continuing forever

definition: moral principles that control or influence a person’s behaviour

definition: connected with beliefs and principles about what is right and wrong

definition: connected with or belonging to a group of people that share a cultural tradition

definition: the unit of money of some countries of the European Union

definition: to move people from a place of danger to a safer place

definition: that can be divided exactly by two

definition: used to emphasize something unexpected or surprising

definition: the part of the day between the afternoon and the time you go to bed

definition: a thing that happens, especially something important

definition: at the end of a period of time or a series of events

definition: all things

definition: to consider or study an idea, a subject, etc. very carefully

definition: to be greater than a particular number or amount

definition: the quality of being extremely good

definition: extremely good
example: an excellent book/article

definition: used before you mention something that makes a statement not completely true

definition: used before you mention the only thing or person about which a statement is not true

definition: feeling or showing happiness and enthusiasm

definition: a possible effect or result of an action or a decision

definition: to suggest that something is true or that you feel or think something, without saying so directly

definition: a product or service that is brought into one country from another
example: import from…, food imports from abroad

definition: to bring a product, a service, an idea, etc. into one country from another
example: import something, The country has to import most of its raw materials.

definition: the quality of being important
example: She stressed the importance of careful preparation.

definition: having a great effect on people or things; of great value

definition: to introduce a new law, rule, tax, etc.; to order that a rule, punishment, etc. be used

definition: that cannot exist or be done; not possible

definition: if a person or thing impresses you, you admire them or it

definition: an idea, a feeling or an opinion that you get about somebody/something, or that somebody/something gives you

definition: making you admire them, because they are very large, good, skilful, etc.

definition: to put somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape

definition: the act of putting somebody in a prison or another place from which they cannot escape; the state of being there

definition: to become better than before; to make something/somebody better than before

definition: the act of making something better; the process of something becoming better

definition: at a point within an area or a space

definition: the fact of not being able to do something

definition: not enough; not good enough

definition: not suitable or appropriate in a particular situation

definition: something that encourages you to do something

definition: a unit for measuring length or height, equal to 2.54 centimetres. There are 12 inches in a foot.

definition: the extent to which something happens or has an effect

definition: something that happens, especially something unusual or unpleasant

definition: having something as part of a group or set

definition: to include something so that it forms a part of something

definition: not accurate or true

definition: a baby or very young child

definition: to have an effect on the way that somebody behaves or thinks, especially by giving them an example to follow

definition: information

definition: facts or details about somebody/something

definition: a person or an animal that lives in a particular place

definition: a new plan for dealing with a particular problem or for achieving a particular purpose

definition: inside; towards or close to the centre of a place

definition: the introduction of new things, ideas or ways of doing something

definition: any small creature with six legs and a body divided into three parts. Insects usually also have wings. Ants, bees and flies are all insects.

definition: having a lot of money or property

definition: to be free of somebody/something that has been annoying you or that you do not want
example: She wanted to be rid of her parents and their authority.

definition: a short journey in a vehicle, on a bicycle, etc.
example: a train ride through beautiful countryside

definition: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and control it as it moves
example: I learnt to ride as a child.

definition: very silly or unreasonable
example: I look ridiculous in this hat.

definition: a gun with a long barrel which you hold to your shoulder to fire
example: a hunting rifle

definition: true or correct as a fact
example: Did you get the answer right?

definition: on or to the right side
example: Turn right at the end of the street.

definition: the right side or direction
example: on the right, Take the first street on the right.

definition: a piece of jewellery that you wear on your finger, consisting of a round band of gold, silver, etc., sometimes decorated with precious stones
example: a gold ring

definition: to surround somebody/something
example: Thousands of demonstrators ringed the building.

definition: a situation in which a group of people behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest
example: One prison guard was killed when a riot broke out in the jail.

definition: to tear something or to become torn, often suddenly or violently
example: rip (something), I ripped my jeans on the fence.

definition: an increase in an amount, a number or a level
example: The industry is feeling the effects of recent price rises.

definition: to come or go upwards; to reach a higher level or position
example: The curtain rose to reveal an empty stage.

definition: the possibility of something bad happening at some time in the future; a situation that could be dangerous or have a bad result
example: The health risks are very low.

definition: to put something valuable or important in a dangerous situation, in which it could be lost or damaged
example: He risked his life to save her.

definition: involving the possibility of something bad happening
example: Life as an aid worker can be a risky business (= dangerous).

definition: a series of actions that are always performed in the same way, especially as part of a religious ceremony
example: religious rituals

definition: competing with another person, company, thing, etc.
example: a rival bid/claim/offer

definition: a person, company or thing that competes with another in sport, business, etc.
example: The two teams have always been rivals.

definition: a natural flow of water that continues in a long line across land to the sea

definition: a hard surface built for vehicles to travel on
example: a main/major/minor road

definition: to steal money or property from a person or place
example: to rob a bank

definition: the crime of stealing money or goods from a bank, shop, person, etc., especially using violence or threats
example: armed robbery (= using a gun, knife, etc.)

definition: a machine that can perform a complicated series of tasks by itself
example: These cars are built by robots.

definition: strong and healthy
example: She was almost 90, but still very robust.

definition: the hard solid material that forms part of the surface of the earth and some other planets
example: They drilled through several layers of rock to reach the oil.

definition: to move gently backwards and forwards or from side to side; to make somebody/something move in this way
example: (+ adv./prep.), The boat rocked from side to side in the waves.

definition: a spacecraft in the shape of a tube that is driven by a stream of gases let out behind it when fuel is burned inside
example: a space rocket

definition: a long straight piece of wood, metal or glass
example: The concrete is reinforced with steel rods.

definition: an actor’s part in a play, film, etc.
example: She has landed the lead role (= the most important one) in a new play.

definition: a small loaf of bread for one person
example: Soup and a roll: £3.50

definition: to turn over and over and move in a particular direction; to make a round object do this
example: + adv./prep., The ball rolled down the hill.

definition: an exciting, usually short, relationship between two people who are in love with each other
example: a holiday romance

definition: connected with or about love or a sexual relationship
example: a romantic candlelit dinner

definition: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building or vehicle
example: a flat/sloping/pitched roof

definition: a part of a building that has its own walls, floor and ceiling and is usually used for a particular purpose
example: I heard him enter the room.

definition: the part of a plant that grows under the ground and takes in water and minerals that it sends to the rest of the plant
example: deep spreading roots

definition: very strong thick string made by twisting thinner strings, wires, etc. together
example: The rope broke and she fell 50 metres onto the rocks.

definition: a flower with a sweet smell that grows on a bush with thorns (= sharp points) on its stems
example: a bunch of red roses

definition: to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do this

definition: the action of an object moving in a circle around a central fixed point

definition: having a surface that is not even or regular

definition: approximately but not exactly
example: Sales are up by roughly 10 per cent.

definition: having a shape like a circle or a ball
example: a round plate

definition: moving in a circle
example: Everybody joins hands and dances round.

definition: a stage in a competition or sports event
example: the qualifying rounds of the National Championships

definition: in a circle
example: the first woman to sail round the world

definition: a way that you follow to get from one place to another
example: Which is the best route to take?

definition: done or happening as a normal part of a particular job, situation or process
example: routine enquiries/questions/tests/screening

definition: the normal order and way in which you regularly do things
example: to settle/get/fall into a routine

definition: connected with or belonging to the king or queen of a country
example: the royal family

definition: to move your hand, a cloth, etc., backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing it
example: rub something, He sat up on the hard bunk and rubbed his eyes.

definition: made of rubber
example: a rubber ball

definition: a strong substance that can be stretched and does not allow liquids to pass through it, used for making tyres, boots, etc. It is made from the liquid (= sap) inside a tropical plant or is produced using chemicals.
example: a ball made of rubber

definition: things that you throw away because you no longer want or need them
example: a rubbish bag/bin

definition: having or showing a lack of respect for other people and their feelings
example: a rude comment/remark

definition: a game played by two teams of 13 or 15 players, using an oval ball which may be kicked or carried. Teams try to put the ball over the other team’s line.
example: to play a game of rugby

definition: the state or process of being destroyed or severely damaged

definition: to damage something so badly that it loses all its value, pleasure, etc.

definition: a statement of what may, must or must not be done in a particular situation or when playing a game

definition: to control and have authority over a country, a group of people, etc.
