definition: an official decision made by somebody in a position of authority, especially a judge
example: The court will make its ruling on the case next week.

definition: a piece of information, or a story, that people talk about, but that may not be true
example: to start/spread a rumour

definition: an act of running; a period of time spent running or the distance that somebody runs
example: I go for a run every morning.

definition: to move using your legs, going faster than when you walk

definition: a person or an animal that runs, especially one taking part in a race

definition: the action or sport of running
example: to go running

definition: connected with or like the countryside
example: rural areas

definition: a sudden strong movement or action
example: rush for something, Shoppers made a rush for the exits.

definition: to move or to do something with great speed, often too fast

definition: to dismiss somebody from a job
example: She was sacked for refusing to work on Sundays.

definition: connected with God or a god; considered to be holy

definition: the fact of giving up something important or valuable to you in order to get or do something that seems more important; something that you give up in this way

definition: to give up something that is important or valuable to you in order to get or do something that seems more important for yourself or for another person
example: sacrifice something for somebody/something, She sacrificed everything for her children.

definition: unhappy or showing unhappiness
example: sad to do something, We are very sad to hear that you are leaving.

definition: in a sad way

definition: protected from any danger, harm or loss

definition: the state of being safe and protected from danger or harm

definition: a sheet of strong cloth which the wind blows against to make a boat or ship travel through the water

definition: to travel on water using sails or an engine

definition: the sport or activity of travelling in a boat with sails

definition: a person who works on a ship as a member of the crew

definition: a person that the Christian Church recognizes as being very holy, because of the way they have lived or died

definition: a mixture of raw vegetables such as lettuce, tomato and cucumber, usually served with other food as part of a meal

definition: money that employees receive for doing their job, especially professional employees or people working in an office, usually paid every month

definition: an act or the process of selling something
example: regulations governing the sale of alcoholic beverages

definition: a white substance that is added to food to make it taste better or to preserve it. Salt is obtained from mines and is also found in seawater. It is sometimes called common salt to show that it is different from other chemical salts. Its chemical name is sodium chloride.
example: Pass the salt, please.

definition: exactly the one or ones referred to or mentioned; not different

definition: the same thing or things

definition: a number of people or things taken from a larger group and used in tests to provide information about the group

definition: to try a small amount of a particular food to see what it is like; to experience something for a short time to see what it is like

definition: an official order that limits trade, contact, etc. with a particular country, in order to make it do something, such as obeying international law

definition: a substance that consists of very small fine grains of rock. Sand is found on beaches, in deserts, etc.

definition: two slices of bread, often spread with butter, with a layer of meat, cheese, etc. between them

definition: an electronic device that is sent into space and moves around the earth or another planet. It is used for communicating by radio, television, etc. and for gathering information.
example: a weather/communications/spy satellite

definition: the good feeling that you have when you have achieved something or when something that you wanted to happen does happen; something that gives you this feeling
example: to gain/get/derive satisfaction from something

definition: pleased because you have achieved something or because something that you wanted to happen has happened

definition: the day of the week after Friday and before Sunday

definition: a thick liquid that is eaten with food to add taste to it

definition: to keep somebody/something safe from death, harm, loss, etc.

definition: an amount of something such as time or money that you do not need to use or spend

definition: behaviour or an event that people think is morally or legally wrong and causes public feelings of shock or anger

definition: spread far apart over a wide area or over a long period of time

definition: any of the four main periods of the year: spring, summer, autumn and winter

definition: a place where you can sit, for example a chair

definition: after one other person or thing in order or importance

definition: happening or coming next after the first in a series of similar things or people; 2nd

definition: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 seconds in one minute.

definition: happening or coming next after the first in a series of similar things or people; 2nd
example: This is the second time it's happened.

definition: an understanding about something; an ability to judge something

definition: aware of and able to understand other people and their feelings

definition: the ability to understand other people’s feelings

definition: a set of words expressing a statement, a question or an order, usually containing a subject and a verb. In written English sentences begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop/period (.), a question mark (?) or an exclamation mark (!).

definition: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions

definition: bad or dangerous

definition: a period of time that is spent doing a particular activity

definition: a group of similar things that belong together in some way

definition: an environment where something is located; the place at which something happens

definition: more than two but not very many

definition: the state of being male or female

definition: the feelings and activities connected with a person’s sexual desires

definition: sexually attractive
example: the sexy lead singer

definition: an act of shaking somebody/something

definition: to move or make somebody/something move with short quick movements from side to side or up and down

definition: not having much distance between the top or surface and the bottom

definition: used to emphasize the size, degree or amount of something

definition: used in questions to ask somebody to be exact about one or more people or things from a limited number
example: Which is better exercise—swimming or tennis?

definition: used in questions to ask somebody to be exact about one or more people or things from a limited number
example: Which is better exercise—swimming or tennis?

definition: during the time that something is happening; at the same time as something else is happening
example: We must have been burgled while we were asleep.

definition: a period of time
example: for a while, I only stayed for a short while.

definition: during the time that something is happening; at the same time as something else is happening
example: In the UK it is illegal to drive whilst holding a mobile phone.

definition: to hit a person or an animal hard with a whip, as a punishment or to make them go faster or work harder
example: He was taken back to the jail and soundly whipped.

definition: a low, quiet voice or the sound it makes
example: in a whisper, ‘I love you,’ he said in a whisper.

definition: to speak very quietly to somebody so that other people cannot hear what you are saying
example: Don't you know it's rude to whisper?

definition: having the colour of fresh snow or of milk
example: a crisp white shirt

definition: the colour of fresh snow or of milk
example: various shades of white

definition: used in questions to ask about the name, identity or function of one or more people
example: Who is that woman?

definition: the person or people who; any person who
example: Whoever says that is a liar.

definition: full; complete
example: Let's forget the whole thing.

definition: all that there is of something
example: The scheme would cover the whole of the UK.

definition: completely
example: wholly inappropriate behaviour

definition: used instead of ‘who’ as the object of a verb or preposition
example: Whom did they invite?

definition: used in questions to ask who something belongs to
example: Whose house is that?

definition: used in questions to ask who something belongs to
example: Whose house is that?

definition: used in questions to ask the reason for or purpose of something
example: Why were you late?

definition: measuring a large distance from one side to the other
example: It's a wide, fast-flowing river.

definition: by a lot of people; in or to many places
example: The term is widely used in everyday speech.

definition: to become wider; to make something wider
example: Her eyes widened in surprise.

definition: existing or happening over a large area or among many people
example: The storm caused widespread damage.

definition: a woman whose husband or wife has died and who has not married again
example: She gets a widow’s pension.

definition: the measurement from one side of something to the other; how wide something is
example: The terrace runs the full width of the house.

definition: the woman that somebody is married to; a married woman
example: I met my wife at university.

definition: living or growing in natural conditions; not kept in a house or on a farm
example: wild animals/birds/flowers

definition: animals, birds, insects, etc. that are wild and live in a natural environment
example: policies designed to protect wildlife

definition: the ability to control your thoughts and actions in order to achieve what you want to do; a strong and determined desire to do something that you want to do
example: to have a strong will

definition: used for talking about or predicting the future
example: You'll be in time if you hurry.

definition: not objecting to doing something; having no reason for not doing something
example: Many consumers are willing to pay more for organic food

definition: the quality of being happy and ready to do something
example: Success in studying depends on a willingness to learn.

definition: a victory in a game, contest, etc.
example: two wins and three defeats

definition: to be the most successful in a competition, race, battle, etc.
example: Which team won?

definition: to have many bends and twists
example: wind + adv./prep., The path wound down to the beach.

definition: an opening in the wall or roof of a building, car, etc., usually covered with glass, that allows light and air to come in and people to see out; the glass in a window
example: out of the window, She looked out of the window.

definition: an alcoholic drink made from the juice of grapes that has been left to ferment. There are many different kinds of wine.
example: sparkling wine

definition: one of the parts of the body of a bird, insect or bat that it uses for flying
example: The swan flapped its wings noisily.

definition: a person, a team, an animal, etc. that wins something
example: The lucky winner gets an all-expenses-paid trip to Sydney.

definition: the coldest season of the year, between autumn and spring
example: a cold/mild/harsh winter

definition: to rub something against a surface, in order to remove dirt or liquid from it; to rub a surface with a cloth, etc. in order to clean it
example: wipe something (on something), Please wipe your feet on the mat.

definition: metal in the form of thin thread; a piece of this
example: a coil of copper wire

definition: the ability to make sensible decisions and give good advice because of the experience and knowledge that you have
example: She was known to be a woman of great wisdom.

definition: able to make sensible decisions and give good advice because of the experience and knowledge that you have
example: a wise man

definition: used especially in a letter, email or card to say that you hope that somebody will be happy, well or successful
example: Give my good wishes to the family.

definition: to want something to happen or to be true even though it is unlikely or impossible
example: wish (that)…, I wish I were taller.

definition: the ability to say or write things that are both clever and humorous
example: to have a quick/sharp/dry/ready wit

definition: in the company or presence of somebody/something
example: She lives with her parents.

definition: to take money out of a bank account
example: withdraw something, With this account, you can withdraw up to £300 a day.

definition: the act of taking an amount of money out of your bank account
example: You can make withdrawals of up to $250 a day.

definition: before a particular period of time has passed; during a particular period of time
example: You should receive a reply within seven days.

definition: not having, experiencing or showing something
example: They had gone two days without food.

definition: a person who sees something happen and is able to describe it to other people
example: He failed to interview a key witness.

definition: to see something happen (typically a crime or an accident)
example: to witness an accident/a murder/an attack

definition: an adult female human
example: a 54-year-old woman

definition: a feeling of surprise and pleasure that you have when you see or experience something beautiful, unusual or unexpected
example: He retained a childlike sense of wonder.

definition: to think about something and try to decide what is true, what will happen, what you should do, etc.
example: ‘Why do you want to know?’ ‘No particular reason. I was just wondering.’

definition: very good, pleasant or a lot of fun
example: This is a wonderful opportunity to invest in new markets.

definition: the hard material that the trunk and branches of a tree are made of; this material when it is used to build or make things with, or as a fuel
example: He chopped some wood for the fire.

definition: made of wood
example: a wooden box/door/floor

definition: the soft hair that covers the body of sheep and some other animals
example: Sheep were kept for their wool and meat.

definition: a single unit of language that means something and can be spoken or written
example: Do not write more than 200 words.

definition: the job that a person does especially in order to earn money
example: He started work as a security guard.

definition: to do something that involves physical or mental effort, especially as part of a job
example: I can't work if I'm cold.

definition: a person who works, especially one who does a particular kind of work
example: farm/factory/office workers

definition: all the people who work for a particular company, organization, etc.
example: The factory has a 1 000-strong workforce.

definition: having a job for which you are paid
example: the working population

definition: a period of physical exercise that you do to keep fit
example: She does a 20-minute workout every morning.

definition: the office, factory, etc. where people work
example: the introduction of new technology into the workplace

definition: a period of discussion and practical work on a particular subject, in which a group of people share their knowledge and experience
example: There will be the opportunity for practical theatre work in drama workshops.

definition: the earth, with all its countries, peoples and natural features
example: a map of the world

definition: affecting all parts of the world
example: an increase in worldwide sales

definition: affecting all parts of the world
example: an increase in worldwide sales

definition: a long, thin creature with a soft body and no bones or legs
example: birds looking for worms

definition: thinking about unpleasant things that have happened or that might happen and therefore feeling unhappy and afraid
example: Don't look so worried!

definition: the state of worrying about something
example: The threat of losing their jobs is a constant source of worry to them.

definition: to keep thinking about unpleasant things that might happen or about problems that you have
example: Don't worry. We have plenty of time.

definition: of poorer quality or lower standard; more unpleasant
example: The rooms were awful and the food was worse.

definition: less well
example: Working-class children fared rather worse.

definition: more problems or bad news
example: I'm afraid there is worse to come.

definition: the practice of showing respect for God or a god, by saying prayers, singing with others, etc.; a ceremony for this
example: an act/a place of worship

definition: to show respect for God or a god, especially by saying prayers, singing, etc. with other people in a religious building
example: The Mayans built jungle pyramids to worship their gods.

definition: of the poorest quality or lowest standard; worse than any other person or thing of a similar kind
example: It was by far the worst speech he had ever made.

definition: most badly or seriously
example: He was voted the worst dressed celebrity.

definition: the most serious or unpleasant thing that could happen; the part, situation, possibility, etc. that is worse than any other
example: When they did not hear from her, they feared the worst.

definition: having a value in money, etc.
example: Our house is worth about £100 000.

definition: an amount of something that has the value mentioned
example: The winner will receive fifty pounds' worth of books.

definition: important, pleasant, interesting, etc.; worth spending time, money or effort on
example: It was in aid of a worthwhile cause (= a charity, etc.).

definition: having the qualities that deserve somebody/something
example: Very few of his ideas are worthy of further attention.

definition: used in polite offers or invitations
example: Would you like a sandwich?

definition: an injury to part of the body, especially one in which a hole is made in the skin using a weapon
example: a gunshot/stab wound

definition: to injure part of the body, especially by making a hole in the skin using a weapon
example: He had been wounded in the arm.

definition: used to show that you are very surprised or impressed by somebody/something
example: Wow! You look terrific!

definition: to cover something completely in paper or other material, for example when you are giving it as a present
example: wrap something up, He spent the evening wrapping up the Christmas presents.

definition: the joint between the hand and the arm
example: She's broken her wrist.

definition: to make letters or numbers on a surface, especially using a pen or a pencil
example: In some countries children don't start learning to read and write until they are six.

definition: a person whose job is writing books, stories, articles, etc.
example: Who's your favourite writer?

definition: the activity of writing, in contrast to reading, speaking, etc.
example: Our son’s having problems with his reading and writing (= at school)

definition: expressed in writing rather than in speech
example: Having a written record of what I've done is very valuable.

definition: not right or correct
example: I got all the answers wrong.

definition: in a way that produces a result that is not correct or that you do not want
example: My name is spelt wrong.

definition: behaviour that is not honest or morally acceptable
example: Children must be taught the difference between right and wrong.

definition: a piece of land next to or around your house where you can grow flowers, fruit, vegetables, etc., usually with a lawn (= an area of grass)
example: They have a gorgeous old oak tree in their front yard.

definition: the period from 1 January to 31 December, that is 365 or 366 days, divided into 12 months
example: Elections take place every year.

definition: to shout loudly, for example because you are angry, excited, frightened or in pain
example: yell (at somebody/something), He yelled at the other driver.

definition: having the colour of lemons or butter
example: pale yellow flowers

definition: the colour of lemons or butter
example: She was dressed in yellow.

definition: used to answer a question and say that something is correct or true
example: ‘Is this your car?’ ‘Yes, it is.’

definition: on the day before today
example: A company spokeswoman said yesterday that no final decision had been made yet.

definition: the day before today
example: Yesterday was Sunday.

definition: used in negative sentences and questions to talk about something that has not happened but that you expect to happen
example: (British English), I haven't received a letter from him yet.

definition: despite what has just been said
example: It's a small car, yet it's surprisingly spacious.

definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced
example: a high crop yield

definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced
example: a high crop yield

definition: used as the subject or object of a verb or after a preposition to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to
example: You said you knew the way.

definition: having lived or existed for only a short time; not fully developed
example: Young babies need to be wrapped up warmly.

definition: young people considered as a group
example: It's a movie that will appeal to the young.

definition: a young person or a child
example: The camp is for youngsters aged 8 to 14.

definition: of or belonging to the person or people being spoken or written to
example: I like your dress.

definition: of or belonging to you
example: Is that book yours?

definition: used when the person or people being spoken to both cause and are affected by an action
example: Have you hurt yourself?

definition: the time of life when a person is young, especially the time before a child becomes an adult
example: in somebody's youth, He had been a talented musician in his youth.

definition: an area or a region with a particular feature or use
example: a war/combat/demilitarized/exclusion zone
